title: 7 big questions facing the new prime minister
description: From the cost of living to the NHS, BBC correspondents examine the issues awaiting in Downing Street.

title: Yungblud: I opened my chest up and put my heart on a plate
description: The pop star explains why his third album is "a metaphor for the oppression millions of people feel".

title: Workplace accidents: Poor workers pay price for India's economic push
description: India is trying to become an industrial powerhouse, but is that coming at the cost of workers' safety?

title: 'Why I made a film about my addiction'
description: Jit Chauhan, 48, was drinking a litre of whisky a day when his alcoholism was at its worst.

title: Chinese motorcyclists join Chongqing wildfire battle
description: The south-western city of Chongqing was one of the areas hit worst by the flames in August's heatwave.

title: MOTD 2 Analysis: Why 'masterful' Christian Eriksen was key to Man Utd beating Arsenal
description: Match of the Day 2 pundit Troy Deeney explains how a "masterful" performance from Christian Eriksen was key to Manchester United's win over Arsenal.

title: Canada rocked by multiple deadly stabbings in Saskatchewan
description: At least 10 people are killed and 15 injured as police launch a manhunt for two suspects.

title: The Papers: 'PM-in-waiting' as 'talks held to freeze bills'
description: The package Liz Truss could introduce in her presumptive first week in No 10 leads Monday's papers.

title: US Open: Coco Gauff beats Zhang Shuai to reach last eight in New York
description: Coco Gauff reaches her maiden US Open quarter-final with a straight-set victory over China's Zhang Shuai.

title: Garth Crooks' Team of the Week: Who showed no mercy? Who is getting the job done for Spurs?
description: Who is getting the job done for Spurs? And who is a 'must' for England if he keeps on showing such composure? Find out in Garth Crooks' latest Team of the Week.

title: Energy costs: How do older people plan to cope?
description: "If I didn't laugh, I'd cry but there's no point - it's not going to get me anywhere," says Susan, 67.

title: Manchester United 3-1 Arsenal: Erik ten Hag praises 'brave' Antony after debut goal
description: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag highlights new signing Antony's bravery and character after his debut goal.

title: Mystery as private plane crashes into Baltic Sea
description: Nato scrambled jets to follow the aircraft on its erratic flight across Europe towards Latvia.

title: Manchester United 3-1 Arsenal: Antony scores on his debut to end Arsenal's winning run
description: Manchester United earn a thrilling victory as Antony scores on his debut and ends Arsenal's winning run in an intense game at Old Trafford.

title: Nirvana win lawsuit over 1991 Nevermind album cover
description: A judge's ruling prevents Spencer Elden from re-filing a case over the Nevermind sleeve

title: Hull City 0-2 Sheffield United: Oli McBurnie and Sander Berge send Blades back to the top
description: Goals from in-form Oli McBurnie and Sander Berge help Sheffield United beat Hull City to reclaim the early lead in the Championship table.

title: Gareth Thomas says ex-partner never asked about his HIV status
description: Gareth Thomas admits not telling Ian Baum, who is suing him, he had HIV, but says he was not asked.

title: Brighton 5-2 Leicester: Brendan Rodgers says 'results down to me'
description: Bottom-of-the-table Leicester City's manager Brendan Rodgers insists results are down to him following defeat by Brighton.

title: Germany announces €65bn package to curb soaring energy costs
description: The government wants to shield its citizens and businesses from the threat of soaring costs this winter.

title: Brighton 5-2 Leicester: Graham Potter's side maintain excellent start to Premier League season
description: Brighton fight back from conceding a first-minute goal to beat struggling Leicester City in a seven-goal thriller at the Amex.

title: Dutch Grand Prix: Max Verstappen wins home race to extend title lead
description: Max Verstappen's serene march to a second title continues with a comfortable victory in an eventful Dutch Grand Prix.

title: 33-day 'Smiling Pope' John Paul I beatified at the Vatican
description: John Paul I led the Catholic Church for 33 days in 1978, with his death causing controversy.

title: New PM's political challenge is to unify a divided Conservative party
description: Will the Conservatives be able to come together after a long summer of public wrangling?

title: Premier League to review VAR decisions with PGMOL
description: The Premier League is to review VAR decisions at Chelsea and Newcastle with referees' organisation PGMOL as a matter of priority.

title: Kensington High Street: Murder arrest after man shot dead
description: The Metropolitan Police said officers were called to Kensington High Street at about 02:00 BST.

title: Olivia Pratt-Korbel: Arrests over nine-year-old's murder
description: Police arrest two men in relation to the murder of the nine-year-old, who was shot in Liverpool.

title: Ethiopia's skater girls: 'Someone had to be the first'
description: Ethiopian Girl Skaters is a female-only skateboarding group that is challenging stereotypes about what activities Ethiopian girls can and should do.

title: Tory leadership: Rishi Sunak says he will support next Conservative government
description: The former chancellor signals he believes he has lost the race to become the next prime minister.

title: The Shard: Climber reported and three men arrested
description: A 21-year-old man is detained on suspicion of scaling the 310m tall skyscraper in central London.

title: Tallaght, Dublin: Three siblings killed in 'violent incident'
description: A man has been arrested and a teenage boy and the children's mother are in hospital in Crumlin.

title: Legionnaire's suspected cause of Argentina pneumonia deaths
description: Health officials believe the infectious pneumonia which killed four was caused by the rare lung disease.

title: Liz Truss pledges energy plan within week if elected PM
description: The Tory leadership favourite says she would act immediately on bills - but gives no further details.

title: Ukraine war: Russia wants to destroy Europeans' normal life, Zelensky warns
description: Russia is trying to attack Europe with "poverty and political chaos", President Zelensky says.

title: The Big Half 2022: Mo Farah and Eilish McColgan win London half-marathon races
description: Mo Farah wins the men's Big Half in London and Eilish McColgan wins the women's race in a course record.

title: Deadly attack targets Somalia food convoy
description: Al-Shabab militants claim to have carried out the attack in the country's central region.

title: Victoria Azarenka wants safeguarding improved for female players
description: Victoria Azarenka says tennis needs to improve safeguarding to stop "vulnerable young ladies getting taken advantage of".

title: Hamas executes two 'Israel collaborators' in Gaza
description: The men had given Israel information which had led to the killing of Palestinians, a statement says.

title: Why Serena Williams has never been defined by chase for Margaret Court's Grand Slam record
description: As Serena Williams retires one Grand Slam short of Margaret Court's record, BBC Sport examines their two careers and asks what makes a GOAT.

title: Barack Obama: Emmy win for narrating Netflix documentary
description: The former president's five-part Netflix documentary series nabs an Emmy for best narrator.

title: Tyson Fury says he will announce his next opponent next week - but it won't be Usyk
description: WBC heavyweight champion Tyson Fury, who insisted he had retired, says he will announce his next opponent next week.

title: Donald Trump: What we learned from his rally in Pennsylvania
description: The ex-president spoke for two hours at his first rally since the search - here is what we learned.

title: The Hundred: Positives persist but organisers still have puzzles to solve
description: The Hundred can take more positives out of its 2022 edition, but there remain significant puzzles to solve if it is to be a sustained success.

title: The Papers: 'Tory in-fighting' and 'price to avoid world war'
description: Sunday's papers focus on calls for the Tory party to unite around the next PM, and the energy crisis.

title: Strictly Come Dancing: New dancers to perform with full cast
description: The new dancers will perform a cinematic routine alongside returning professionals in the launch show.

description: The two contenders to become PM are set be asked about their proposals for office on BBC One.

title: US Open: Daniil Medvedev to face Nick Kyrgios in New York night session
description: Daniil Medvedev says fans can expect the unexpected when he meets fellow firebrand Nick Kyrgios in the US Open last 16 on Sunday.

title: British army trains with Swedish and Finnish forces
description: The UK has agreed a pact with the two Nordic nations to help each other if they were attacked.

title: Klyuchevskaya Sopka: Climbers killed during a fall on Russian volcano
description: Six people are known to have died and rescuers are unable to reach survivors, local media say.

title: Metropolitan Police must learn from appalling mistakes - Patel
description: The home secretary calls for "extensive reform" in a letter to the incoming Met Police chief.

title: Deptford: The London high street voted one of the world's coolest
description: Deptford High Street was named one of the world's top 33 streets but does it face an uncertain future?
